The BMC Icon Font may be used as standalone icons inline; simply add the icon class to a tag

Example

Algorithms can be expressed in many kinds of notation, including natural:

  • – languages,
  • – pseudocode,
  • – flowcharts,
  • – drakon,
  • – programming languages,
  • – or control tables (processed by interpreters).

Code

<span class="d-icon-internet"></span> – languages,
<span class="d-icon-qrcode"></span> – pseudocode,
<span class="d-icon-flow"></span> – flowcharts,
<span class="d-icon-files_change_o"></span> – drakon,
<span class="d-icon-heart_o"></span> – programming languages,
<span class="d-icon-table"></span> – or control tables (processed by interpreters).

When using icons with text, a link or a button, you will need to specify the position of the icon by selecting the appropriate class

Example

Simple Link

Code

<a class="d-icon-left-angle_right d-icon-right-triangle_down">Simple Link</a>
<button class="d-icon-left-plus">Add Item</button>

The size and the color of the icon can easily be controlled with CSS

Example

Hamburger menu

Code

<a class="d-icon-left-lines">Hamburger menu</a>

Using external svg-icons

Example

Code

<svg class="icon-inline" style="fill:green">
   <use xlink:href="dist/svg/dpl-iconfont-sprite.svg#align_left"></use>
</svg>

<svg class="icon-inline" style="fill:red">
   <use xlink:href="dist/svg/dpl-iconfont-sprite.svg#chart_pie"></use>
</svg>

Utilities

Example

  • flip icon vertical

  • rotate 180 degree
  • rotate 270 degree
